contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=January 2007}} {{Anarchism sidebar}} The '''WOMBLES''' ('''White Overalls Movement Building Libertarian Effective Struggles''') are a loosely aligned [[anarchist]] and [[Anti-capitalism|anti-capitalist]] group based in [[London]]. They gained prominence in the early 2000s for wearing white overalls with padding and helmets at protests, mimicking the Italian group [[Tute Bianche]]. ==History== The group was founded by some of those who came together as the September26Collective to organise transport to Prague for actions to disrupt the meeting of the World Bank and IMF, on their return. Since then they have participated, and helped organise, various protests, including the [[Halloween 2002 protest]], and [[May Day 2001]], [[Thessaloniki]], [[â‚¬uroMayDay]] and [[31st G8 summit#Activism|Gleneagles]]. They claim to operate in a "non-hierarchical but self-disciplined way". "On [[May Day|Mayday]] 2000 the cops gave [the protesters] a good kicking", [http://www.wombles.org.uk/ their website]{{Dead link|date=March 2012}} says. In response to this, the group was started to provide "self-protection from the depredations of the constabulary" (the [[police]]). They have since abandoned their trademark white overalls because they found it made them too visible and open to attack, instead favouring clothing that enables them to be anonymous. In July 2004 they attended the [[Peoples Global Action]] Conference in [[Jajinci]], [[Serbia]].<ref>[http://old.pgaconference.org/_PGA2004reports/0724-1Dalies.html Content of the PGA Daily of Saturday 24-07-2004] Accessed 8 November 2008</ref> In October 2004 they helped organise ''Beyond ESF''<ref>http://www.wombles.org.uk/article20060455.php</ref> at Middlesex University's Tottenham campus. It was organised as an anti-authoritarian alternative to the [[European Social Forum]], happening in London at the same time. ==Relationship with the mainstream media== The WOMBLES quickly became used by much of the UK's mainstream media as a personification of the anti-capitalist and [[anti-globalisation]] movements. The [[Evening Standard]] in particular decided to 'infiltrate' the WOMBLES before the 2001,<ref>http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/news/article-935389-prepare-for-may-day-madness.do</ref> 2002<ref>http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/news/article-443423-inside-wombles-hq-with-target-h.do</ref> and 2003<ref>http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/news/article-4646991-underground-with-the-wombles.do</ref> Mayday protests in London. Even after the WOMBLES had ceased to organise large scale demonstrations the UK media continued to use their name, as shorthand for a "notorious group" of anarchists. For example, the 2006 Sack Parliament demonstration was linked to the WOMBLES in the [[Daily Mail]],<ref>http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-408914/Womble-riot-threat-Commons-opens.html</ref> whilst the WOMBLES were said to be organising against the G20 according to the [[Daily Mirror|Mirror]].<ref>http://www.mirror.co.uk/sunday-mirror/2009/03/29/anarchy-back-in-the-uk-115875-21236624/</ref> ==Aims== Some of their professed aims of the WOMBLES include: *to facilitate free movement and communication during protests; *to stop attacks on demonstrators - such as baton charges, horse charges, [[CS gas]] and sprays; *to be living examples of our libertarian solidarity, organisation, and humour; *to promote mutual respect and protection among demonstrators. <!-- Image with unknown copyright status removed: [[Image:Climate Camp 04.jpg|{{puic|1=Image:Climate Camp 04.jpg|log=2008 September 19}}]] --> ==See also== *[[Anti-globalization]] *[[Anarchism]] *[[Civil and social disobedience]] *[[Disobbedienti]] *[[London Action Resource Centre]] *[[Tute Bianche]] *[[Ya Basta]] *[[Zapatista Army of National Liberation]] ==External links== *[http://anarchistinterviews.podomatic.com/entry/2009-01-31T09_21_49-08_00/ Interview with a member of the WOMBLES] ==References== <references/> {{DEFAULTSORT:Wombles}} [[Category:Activism]] [[Category:Anarchist organisations in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Direct action]]
